meanings.definition: A person who grows or sells carrots.
meanings.sent1: The carrotier at the market had the freshest carrots.
meanings.sent2: My neighbor is a carrotier and always has a bountiful harvest.
meanings.sent3: The carrotier told a joke about a carrot walking into a bar.
meanings.sent4: Her orange shirt made her look like a carrotier in the field.
meanings.sent5: The carrotier's hands were always stained with earth from tending to the carrots.

meanings.definition: Comparative form of the adjective 'carroty', meaning resembling a carrot in color or texture.
meanings.sent1: The sunset had a beautiful, carrotier hue.
meanings.sent2: Her hair was a carrotier shade of red than mine.
meanings.sent3: The carrotier paint on the wall made the room feel cozy.
meanings.sent4: The autumn leaves turned a carrotier color as the season progressed.
meanings.sent5: The carrotier fabric of the blanket was soft to the touch.
